result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S. Riedel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).
  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Counts #2 and #3:
The Court sentences Mr. Riedel to 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  5 years.  These sentences are to be served concurrent to eachother, to begin FORTHWITH

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution to Gary Quackenbusch in the amount of $2997.40

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent

--no possession of illegal drugs or alcohol

--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent

--random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: Lake Mills PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called at 3:06pm
Defendant Matthew S. Riedel in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " NO CONTEST  " entered on Counts #2 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Riedel guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #1

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Victim Impact Statement submitted by ADA Hall

On Counts #2 and #3:
The Court sentences Mr. Riedel   to  7  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  5 years.  These sentences are to be served concurrent to eachother, to begin FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives   1  day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--no possession of illegal drugs or alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to pay restitution to Gary Quackenbusch in the amount of $2997.40
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay statutory costs

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 3:29pm
to Produce and Transport the Defendant from the Dane County Jail on 6-20-2016 & 6-21-2016 for proceedings in Branch 4
to Produce and Transport the Defendant from the Dane County Jail on 6-14-2016 for proceedings in Branch 4
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2016 at 01:40 pm.

[MK] case called at 2:41pm. 
Defendant Matthew S. Riedel in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court grants the State's request to admit statements made by the Defendant at trial.  
The Court confirms with Attorney Svehlek that there is no need for a Miranda Goodchild Hearing.
Attorney Svehlek requests another pretrial conference opportunity.
The Court grants this request. 
The Court clarifies to Mr. Riedel that the Final Status-Scheduling Conference is the final opportunity for a change of plea; the Court will not accept pleas after the Final Status Scheduling Conference has concluded.  
recess 2:42pm.  

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on June 1st at 1:40pm--send notices  (2) the June 14th FSSC and the June 20th & 21st Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar
Motion hearing on May 19, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant
Jury trial on June 20 or 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Case called at  [sf]
Defendant Matthew S. Riedel in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek advises that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Address and DOB information verified with the defendant by the Court
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $7,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No use of controlled substances unless prescribed 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia unless prescribed including needles
-No contact with Gary Quakenbush or Scott Jilek
-No presence at the residences of Gary Quakenbush or Scott Jilek
-No weapons as defined by Statute
-No presence in Pawn Shops

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit requested by the State

Recess: 1:25 pm
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing scheduled for 2/22/16 at 11:00 am  - send notices
